com.badwater.kamaia.EventSystem.EventDispatcher

Class Dispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badwater.kamaia.EventSystem.EventDispatcher.Dispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Dispatcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Created by Krystal on 2015-05-18. This class is a singleton, there should only ever be one. Event Dispatcher class. Runs on it's own thread. Handles dispatching events through channels.

      • run

        public void run()
        The Event Dispatch Loop. Iterates over the channels, and if a recipient is listening to a channel on which an event occurs calls the recipients onEvent() method. For some reason this is not working....
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getChannelByName

        public Channel getChannelByName(java.lang.String channelName)
        Returns a channel whose name matches the search pattern. Names are not case sensitive.
        Parameters:
        channelName - the channel which matches the search pattern channelName
        Returns:
        a channel if found, else returns null.

      • registerEvent

        public boolean registerEvent(Event e,
                    java.lang.String channelName)
        Registers a new event to be dispatched.
        Parameters:
        e - the event calling this method.
        channelName - the channel name to register the event to.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false on failure.

      • registerRecipient

        public boolean registerRecipient(IEventRecipient ier,
                        java.lang.String channelName)
        Registers a new EventRecipient with the dispatcher.
        Parameters:
        ier - an IEventRecipient to register with the dispatcher.
        channelName - the channel to register the recipient to.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if not.
